content.question: The circuit shown consists of the following items in series: an ideal battery of voltage <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and two resistors of resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in series. Which of the following circuits shows the addition of another resistor of resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to the original circuit that will result in the greatest increase in current from the battery?

choices.label: The figure presents a rectangular circuit. The top side has two resistors, each labeled R. The bottom side has a battery labeled V to the right of a resistor labeled R.
The figure presents a rectangular circuit with three resistors on the top side, each labeled R, and a battery on the bottom side labeled v.
The figure presents a rectangular circuit with two resistors on the top side, each labeled R. The bottom side has a resistor labeled R to the right of a battery labeled v.
The figure presents a rectangular circuit. The top left side has two resistors in parallel, each labeled R. The top right side has a resistor labeled R. The bottom side has a battery labeled v.
The figure presents rectangular circuit. The top side has resistors in parallel with a resistor labeled R above two resistors, each labeled R. The bottom side has a battery labeled v.

content.answer: The figure presents rectangular circuit. The top side has resistors in parallel with a resistor labeled R above two resistors, each labeled R. The bottom side has a battery labeled v.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
